review_title: Great place to build a research career
pros: Light teaching and admin duties, great research infrastructure
cons: University administration in Germany is sometimes slowly moving

pros: University has incredible resources for research
cons: Very chaotic organization and university cares little about employees

pros: While being in academia and studying, you can contribute to different projects from the research labs, and earn at the same time. This is very important to mention the advantages of being not isolated from the education ecosystem.
cons: Salaries ar moderate. Could be a little bit better

pros: You can find many english jobs. Professional environment
cons: Documentation language is mostly in german.

pros: University classes related to AI having strong mathematical background, therefore ML, DL and Robotics classes are highly depends on both theory and practical skills
cons: Some classes have only math theory which you do not practice coding enough

pros: Clean and organized enviroment with possibility of high connections
cons: A bit hard to adapt to and not easy to make mistakes

pros: Excellent working environment and friendly teams.
cons: In my experience, I cannot tell of any cons.

pros: It helped me a lot for finding a full time job afterwards
cons: No benefits, burocracy takes too long

pros: A lot of opportunities to grow, and many good initiatives and programs. An outstanding offer of the workshop for Ph.D. students!
cons: Not really adjusted for international student but it is improving a it depends on the department. Some Ph.D. supervisors are not evaluated enough.

review_title: Great opportunities for plant sciences students
pros: Hands-on experience in industrial skills Exposure to bioinformatics and data analysis Improved skills in research Learn Scientific writing and documentation
cons: Less exposure to inter-disciplinary areas like Intellectual property rights, etc.

pros: The best working environment in it.
cons: nothing wrong as far as I can see till now

pros: Friendly work environment and flexible working hours.
cons: Pay can be too little given the effort spent during times of teaching.

review_title: Decent salary, difficult administration for foreigners
pros: The salary is good for a postdoctoral position
cons: The administrative part is a bit difficult, especially when you cannot make phone call in German.

pros: Friendly colleages and profesional work envirnoment.
cons: The salary could be higher

pros: Very good work life balance
cons: The city is not great

pros: Small, personal working environment. Opportunities for further education. Close exchange with colleagues from other institutes.
cons: Staff shortage in the administration

review_title: Freedom to study and work with nice environment
pros: Working as a student assistant in the university, the uni gives good opportunities to everyone who is willing to learn and research. All professors are super nice and available. There is lot of freedom compared to other uni
cons: nothing much to say .

pros: Good research environment with broad expertise.
cons: Very big institution with lengthy processes and complex decision-making culture

pros: Decent working environment, paid vacation
cons: The bureaucracy can take a lot of time

pros: Strong academic culture with diverse research areas
cons: Small city, few people, but it has great connections outwards

pros:
1. People are kind and are willing to help internationals who do not speak German.
2. Quite good salary in German standard.
3. A total of 30-day paid leaves per year.
4. Great office environment.
cons: Most of the university operations and events are only for German speaking people, so as an international I often feel excluded.

pros:
Very international environment.
Cutting edge research
cons:
Need more globalization at univeristy.
Need to work on outing activities

review_title: Be mindful of Phd career choice
pros: Freedom of work time. Flexible working schedule in labs.
cons: Strong pressure to publish, can be stressful

pros:
Nice and great working environment. 
Good supervisor and colleagues.
cons: Sometime gets boring while working in the lab and aliquoting.

pros: Support from Professor and other Graduate Teaching Assistants. Money was always paid on time and full amount.
cons: Sometimes required more hours than expected (also sometimes less)

pros: It has many opportunities, especially look for different jobs and relief place
cons: finding job is german is mostly wanted, less opportunity for the English jobs

pros: It offers great research opportunities.
cons: I do not find any con.

pros: Nice working environment and facilities, good research topics
cons: short term contracts, e.g., 6 months

review_title: Great place to study economics at graduate level
pros: Interactive lively research environment, well designed lectures
cons: too many students are admited, the level is not always as desired

pros: Excellent access to scientific facilities and a lot of funding opportunities
cons:
Rather limited acceptance of cross-field expertise and proposal
Limited supervision 
Negative philosophy of constantly pointing at individual mistakes: you win as a group, lose as an individual

pros: Very nice location and I am very happy with the job.
cons: N/A There are no cons.

pros: It is a great place to work
cons: no cons as of now

pros:
- High qulaity research.
- Independence.
- opportunity to teach and interact with people from different domain and skill sets.
cons:
- contractual employment 
- lack of real world problem solving tool developmet.

pros: The time schedule is flexible with your classes. The work environment is perfect.
cons: Administration processes can be really slow.

review_title: Research Work at Univesrity of Bonn
pros: Flexible Working hours, interesting work (depending on your project), teaching and communication with interesting people
cons: Limited contracts, high hierarchy, poor perspectives to scientists/postdocs / lecturers, very poor diversity on higher profile jobs

job_title: Senior Scientist TV L E14 STUFE 3 in Bonn
pros:
Standard salary as per TV-L
Career advice
cons:
Temporary contract
Professors dont help much in improving the postdocs. In other words they don't promote their students for becoming professors

pros: good environment, good infrastructure, other perks
cons: no permanent position at the given position

pros: Good for Work and Study
cons: As far as i understand there is no cons.

pros: ambitious, well funded, respected institution
cons: stressful, political games for personnel promotion

pros: the salary of public service position is as expected and transparent
cons: academia is indeed a comfort zone

pros:
- Cool projects and environment
- Good University
- Good funding
cons: - Nothing really to say here

pros: Big research network to collaborate with
cons: Organization could definitely be better

pros: Very helpful and supportive advisor, friendly working atmosphere, great seminars/conferences, higher salary compared to PhD programs in the U.S. in general.
cons: No summer and winter breaks to gain industry experiences.

review_title: Powerful theory and normal coding in AI
pros: very powerful artificial intelligence knowledge can be received
cons: too much theory, coding parts in some courses can be improved

pros: It is a great place to work
cons: Sometimes it is not that good

pros: It grows a lot at the moment, especially in Immunology research
cons: It can be very competitive environment for research

pros:
Flexible work hours
Proficiency in brain analysis
cons: Work pressure (as it is in general the case in academia)

pros: dedicated professors with teaching enthusiasm
cons: terrible facilities, the blackboard always glares

review_title: Great place to be a physics PhD student
pros:
- competent researchers
- Flexible working hours
- A friendly environment
- I had a great adviser (but depends on the group, of course)
- Food is cheap
cons:
- You need to give tutorials to master students
- Overtime is usual and unpaid
- Can be quite stressful
- Difficult work-life balance
- Many meetings

pros:
Bonn is a very good place to start a scientific career. There are plenty opportunities for networking, collaboration and in Bonn you can have a very good work-life-balance.
Especially in the field of physics you have the possibility to start projects with other fields of science involved.
cons: One of the drawbacks of the German university system is, that ones salary is not that good unless you have a PhD.

pros:
Good work-life balance. Nice place to work with lots of international students/researchers. 
Physics and Mathematics departments are top-class.
cons:
The university has a low brand value in general.  It is not a big name internationally and thus it might be difficult to sell your school name.
Does not put emphasis on on-campus recruitments.

review_title: Research in Immunology is cutting edge, well funded and networking possibilities are great.
pros:
Good funding of Immunological projects
Good communication between scientists
Most important core facilities are present
University is constantly investing into new infrastructure for biomedical department
cons:
Ordering systems are complicated
Trying to save money costs more than it saves

pros: Computer vision and machine learning groups are working on exciting projects and producing state of the art solutions.
cons: The contracts are not always full-time. University management usually sends emails in German, which is not good since it's a university of Excellence now and not convenient for international students/employees.

pros: Very friendly atmosphere, flexible work hours, lots of learning opportunities.
cons: It's a student job so the compensations is not amazing. If you want real salary, don't search for SHK job.

review_title: Its a great place for research and development
pros: Very good atmosphere, competent staff
cons: not so many as compared to other institutes

review_title: good experience at university of bonn
pros: international research environment to conduct research
cons: language barrier is difficult to overcome

pros:
Leading professor and researchers in the field
Autonomous time management
Research freedom
Nice working environment
cons:
Below average payment
Occasional lack of supervision

pros: Welcoming place to start research
cons: Extremely slow in administrative stuff and paper works

pros:
Very international and friendly atmosphere
Independence in research activities
cons: Sometimes the university lacks connections to industry partners

pros: great for research and learning
cons: limited contracts and very few permanent positions

pros: nice environment, cool to work with master students
cons: professors are really nice and helpful

pros: Flexible working hours, Good salary
cons: Nothing to mention here. Great

pros: Independent working style. Good research facilities.
cons: Independence comes with calculated risks.

pros: International, groundbreaking research, great facilities
cons: I really didn't see any.

pros: A lot of money for traveling if you are associated with research funding groups.
cons: Students are rather competitive.
